pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:0.5.eng: 3. The training rule on malicious talebearing

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ pesuññaṃ upasaṃharanti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were engaged in malicious talebearing between monks who were arguing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.3.pli: imassa sutvā amussa akkhāyanti, imassa bhedāya; amussa sutvā imassa akkhāyanti, amussa bhedāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.3.eng: After hearing something on one side they reported it to the other side, and vice versa, in order to create division between them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.4.pli: Tena anuppannāni ceva bhaṇḍanāni uppajjanti, uppannāni ca bhaṇḍanāni bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.4.eng: In this way they started new quarrels and made existing quarrels worse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.5.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.5.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ pesuññaṃ upasaṃharissanti, imassa sutvā amussa akkhāyissanti, imassa bhedāya;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.6.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six engage in malicious talebearing between monks who are arguing?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.7.pli: amussa sutvā imassa akkhāyissanti, amussa bhedāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.7.eng: How can they report to one side what they have heard on the other side, and vice versa, in order to create division,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.8.pli: Tena anuppannāni ceva bhaṇḍanāni uppajjanti, uppannāni ca bhaṇḍanāni bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.8.eng: and in this way start new quarrels and make existing quarrels worse?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.9.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned those monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ pesuññaṃ upasaṃharatha, imassa sutvā amussa akkhāyatha, imassa bhedāya, amussa sutvā imassa akkhāyatha, amussa bhedāya?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.11.pli: Tena anuppannāni ceva bhaṇḍanāni uppajjanti, uppannāni ca bhaṇḍanāni bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattantī”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.14.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ pesuññaṃ upasaṃharissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.14.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.15.pli: Imassa sutvā amussa akkhāyissatha, imassa bhedāya. Amussa sutvā imassa akkhāyissatha, amussa bhedāya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.16.pli: Tena anuppannāni ceva bhaṇḍanāni uppajjanti, uppannāni ca bhaṇḍanāni bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattanti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.19.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.19.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.20.1.eng: ‘If a monk engages in malicious talebearing between monks, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:1.20.1.comm: This is translated somewhat freely in accordance with the explanation below and in the commentary. According to Bu Pc 3:2.3.1 the offense is only incurred when a monk brings the words of another monk to the attention of yet another monk, and thus the translation “between monks”. Sp 2.37 supports the plural rendering “monks”: Bhikkhūnaṁ pesuññe, “Malicious talebearing of monks”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.2.pli: dvīhākārehi pesuññaṃ hoti— piyakamyassa vā bhedādhippāyassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.2.eng: there is malicious talebearing in two ways: for one wanting to endear himself and for one aiming at division.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.3.pli: Dasahākārehi pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— jātitopi, nāmatopi, gottatopi, kammatopi, sippatopi, ābādhatopi, liṅgatopi, kilesatopi, āpattitopi, akkosatopi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.3.eng: One engages in malicious talebearing in ten ways: about caste, about name, about family, about occupation, about profession, about illnesses, about physical traits, about defilements, about offenses, and by name-calling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.5.pli: dve jātiyo— hīnā ca jāti ukkaṭṭhā ca jāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.5.eng: there are two kinds of castes: low castes and high castes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.7.pli: caṇḍālajāti venajāti nesādajāti rathakārajāti pukkusajāti. Esā hīnā nāma jāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.7.eng: outcasts, bamboo workers, hunters, carriage makers, waste removers—these are called “low castes”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.9.pli: khattiyajāti brāhmaṇajāti. Esā ukkaṭṭhā nāma jāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.9.eng: aristocrats and brahmins—these are called “high castes”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.10.eng: (To be expanded as in previous rule.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.12.pli: dve akkosā— hīno ca akkoso ukkaṭṭho ca akkoso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.12.eng: there are two kinds of name-calling: low name-calling and high name-calling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.14.pli: “oṭṭhosi, meṇḍosi, goṇosi, gadrabhosi, tiracchānagatosi, nerayikosi; natthi tuyhaṃ sugati; duggatiyeva tuyhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā”ti, yakārena vā bhakārena vā kāṭakoṭacikāya vā. Eso hīno nāma akkoso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.14.eng: “You’re a camel,” “You’re a ram,” “You’re an ox,” “You’re a donkey,” “You’re an animal,” “You’re bound for hell,” “You’re not going to a good destination,” “You can only expect a bad destination,” or adding disparaging endings to someone’s name, or calling someone words for the male and female genitals—this is called “low name-calling”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.16.pli: “paṇḍitosi, byattosi, medhāvīsi, bahussutosi, dhammakathikosi; natthi tuyhaṃ duggati; sugatiyeva tuyhaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā”ti. Eso ukkaṭṭho nāma akkoso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.1.16.eng: “You’re wise,” “You’re competent,” “You’re intelligent,” “You’re learned,” “You’re an expounder of the Teaching,” “You’re not going to a bad destination,” “You can only expect a good destination”—this is called “high name-calling”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘caṇḍālo veno nesādo rathakāro pukkuso’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.1.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s an outcast,’ ‘He’s a bamboo worker,’ ‘He’s a hunter,’ ‘He’s a carriage maker,’ ‘He’s a waste remover,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.2.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘khattiyo brāhmaṇo’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.2.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s an aristocrat,’ ‘He’s a brahmin,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.3.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘avakaṇṇako javakaṇṇako dhaniṭṭhako saviṭṭhako kulavaḍḍhako’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.3.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s an Avakaṇṇaka,’ ‘He’s a Javakaṇṇaka,’ ‘He’s a Dhaniṭṭhaka,’ ‘He’s a Saviṭṭhaka,’ ‘He’s a Kulavaḍḍhaka,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.4.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘buddharakkhito dhammarakkhito saṅgharakkhito’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.4.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s a Buddharakkhita,’ ‘He’s a Dhammarakkhita,’ ‘He’s a Sangharakkhita,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.5.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘kosiyo bhāradvājo’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.5.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s a Kosiya,’ ‘He’s a Bhāradvāja,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.6.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘gotamo moggallāno kaccāno vāsiṭṭho’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.6.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s a Gotama,’ ‘He’s a Moggallāna,’ ‘He’s a Kaccāna,’ ‘He’s a Vāsiṭṭha,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.7.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘koṭṭhako pupphachaḍḍako’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.7.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s a carpenter,’ ‘He’s a waste remover,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.8.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘kassako vāṇijo gorakkho’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.8.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s a farmer,’ ‘He’s a trader,’ ‘He’s a cattle keeper,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.9.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘naḷakāro kumbhakāro pesakāro cammakāro nahāpito’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.9.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s a reed worker,’ ‘He’s a potter,’ ‘He’s a weaver,’ ‘He’s a leather worker,’ ‘He’s a hairdresser,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.10.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘muddiko gaṇako lekhako’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.10.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s an arithmetician,’ ‘He’s an accountant,’ ‘He’s a clerk,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.11.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘kuṭṭhiko gaṇḍiko kilāsiko sosiko apamāriko’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.11.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s a leper,’ ‘He has abscesses,’ ‘He has mild leprosy,’ ‘He has tuberculosis,’ ‘He’s an epileptic,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.12.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘madhumehiko’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.12.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s a diabetic,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.13.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘atidīgho atirasso atikaṇho accodāto’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.13.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s too tall,’ ‘He’s too short,’ ‘He’s too dark,’ ‘He’s too fair,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.14.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘nātidīgho nātirasso nātikaṇho nāccodāto’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.14.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s not too tall,’ ‘He’s not too short,’ ‘He’s not too dark,’ ‘He’s not too fair,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.15.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘rāgapariyuṭṭhito dosapariyuṭṭhito mohapariyuṭṭhito’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.15.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s full of sensual desire,’ ‘He’s full of ill will,’ ‘He’s full of confusion,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.16.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘vītarāgo vītadoso vītamoho’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.16.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s without sensual desire,’ ‘He’s without ill will,’ ‘He’s without confusion,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.17.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘pārājikaṃ ajjhāpanno, saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpanno, thullaccayaṃ ajjhāpanno, pācittiyaṃ ajjhāpanno, pāṭidesanīyaṃ ajjhāpanno, dukkaṭaṃ ajjhāpanno, dubbhāsitaṃ ajjhāpanno’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.17.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He has committed an offense entailing expulsion,’ ‘He has committed an offense entailing suspension,’ ‘He has committed a serious offense,’ ‘He has committed an offense entailing confession,’ ‘He has committed an offense entailing acknowledgment,’ ‘He has committed an offense of wrong conduct,’ ‘He has committed an offense of wrong speech,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.18.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘sotāpanno’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.18.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s a stream-enterer,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.19.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘oṭṭho meṇḍo goṇo gadrabho tiracchānagato nerayiko, natthi tassa sugati, duggatiyeva tassa pāṭikaṅkhā’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.19.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s a camel,’ ‘He’s a ram,’ ‘He’s an ox,’ ‘He’s a donkey,’ ‘He’s an animal,’ ‘He’s bound for hell,’ ‘He’s not going to a good destination,’ ‘He can only expect a bad destination,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.20.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo taṃ ‘paṇḍito byatto medhāvī bahussuto dhammakathiko, natthi tassa duggati, sugatiyeva tassa pāṭikaṅkhā’ti bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.20.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says this about you, ‘He’s wise,’ ‘He’s competent,’ ‘He’s intelligent,’ ‘He’s learned,’ ‘He’s an expounder of the Teaching,’ ‘He’s not going to a bad destination,’ ‘He can only expect a good destination,’” then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.21.1.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo ‘santi idhekacce caṇḍālā venā nesādā rathakārā, pukkusā’ti bhaṇati, na so aññaṃ bhaṇati, taññeva bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.21.1.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says, ‘There are outcasts right here,’ ‘There are bamboo workers right here,’ ‘There are hunters right here,’ ‘There are carriage makers right here,’ ‘There are waste removers right here,’ and he’s not speaking about someone else, he’s speaking about you,” then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.22.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo ‘santi idhekacce khattiyā brāhmaṇā’ti bhaṇati, na so aññaṃ bhaṇati, taññeva bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya dukkaṭassa …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.22.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says, ‘There are aristocrats right here,’ ‘There are brahmins right here,’ and he’s not speaking about someone else, he’s speaking about you,” then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.23.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo ‘santi idhekacce paṇḍitā byattā medhāvī bahussutā dhammakathikā, natthi tesaṃ duggati, sugatiyeva tesaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā’ti bhaṇati, na so aññaṃ bhaṇati, taññeva bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.23.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says, ‘There are wise ones right here,’ ‘There are competent ones right here,’ ‘There are intelligent ones right here,’ ‘There are learned ones right here,’ ‘There are expounders of the Teaching right here,’ ‘There are those not going to a bad destination right here,’ ‘There are those who can only expect a good destination right here,’ and he’s not speaking about someone else, he’s speaking about you,” then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.24.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo ‘ye nūna caṇḍālā venā nesādā rathakārā pukkusā’ti bhaṇati, na so aññaṃ bhaṇati, taññeva bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.24.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says, ‘Perhaps these are outcasts,’ ‘Perhaps these are bamboo workers,’ ‘Perhaps these are hunters,’ ‘Perhaps these are carriage makers,’ ‘Perhaps these are waste removers,’ and he’s not speaking about someone else, he’s speaking about you,” then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.24.comm: I have added the ellipses points, which are presumably missing in the Pali due to an editing mistake, cf. Bu Pc 3:2.2.22. The ellipses points are also missing at Bu Pc 3:2.2.26.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.25.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo ‘ye nūna paṇḍitā byattā medhāvī bahussutā dhammakathikā’ti bhaṇati, na so aññaṃ bhaṇati, taññeva bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.25.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says, ‘Perhaps these are wise ones,’ ‘Perhaps these are competent ones,’ ‘Perhaps these are intelligent ones,’ ‘Perhaps these are learned ones,’ ‘Perhaps these are expounders of the Teaching,’ and he’s not speaking about someone else, he’s speaking about you,” then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.26.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo ‘na mayaṃ caṇḍālā venā nesādā rathakārā pukkusā’ti bhaṇati, na so aññaṃ bhaṇati, taññeva bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.26.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says, ‘We’re not outcasts,’ ‘We’re not bamboo workers,’ ‘We’re not hunters,’ ‘We’re not carriage makers,’ ‘We’re not waste removers,’ and he’s not speaking about someone else, he’s speaking about you,” then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.27.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati— “itthannāmo ‘na mayaṃ paṇḍitā byattā medhāvī bahussutā dhammakathikā, natthamhākaṃ duggati, sugatiyeva amhākaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā’ti bhaṇati, na so aññaṃ bhaṇati, taññeva bhaṇatī”ti. Āpatti vācāya, vācāya dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.27.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing by saying to yet another who is fully ordained, “So-and-so says, ‘We’re not wise ones,’ ‘We’re not competent ones,’ ‘We’re not intelligent ones,’ ‘We’re not learned ones,’ ‘We’re not expounders of the Teaching,’ ‘We’re not going to a bad destination,’ ‘We can only expect a good destination,’ and he’s not speaking about someone else, he’s speaking about you,” then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.2.27.comm: This looks like an editing mistake. Presumably this should read, “We’re not going to a good destination/we can only expect a bad destination.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.3.1.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati; āpatti vācāya, vācāya pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.3.1.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing to yet another who is fully ordained, then for every statement, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.3.2.pli: Upasampanno upasampannassa sutvā anupasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.3.2.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from another who is fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing to one who is not fully ordained, then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.3.3.pli: Upasampanno anupasampannassa sutvā upasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.3.3.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from one who is not fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing to another who is fully ordained, then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.3.4.pli: Upasampanno anupasampannassa sutvā anupasampannassa pesuññaṃ upasaṃharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.3.4.eng: If one who is fully ordained, after hearing it from one who is not fully ordained, engages in malicious talebearing to another who is not fully ordained, then for every statement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.4.2.eng: if he does not want to endear himself

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.4.3.eng: and he is not aiming at division;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.4.5.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc3:2.4.6.eng: The training rule on malicious talebearing, the third, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:0.5.eng: 30. The training rule on sitting in private

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato udāyissa purāṇadutiyikā bhikkhunīsu pabbajitā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.2.eng: Venerable Udāyī’s ex-wife became a nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.3.pli: Sā āyasmato udāyissa santike abhikkhaṇaṃ āgacchati, āyasmāpi udāyī tassā bhikkhuniyā santike abhikkhaṇaṃ gacchati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.3.eng: She often went to see Udāyī, and he often went to see her.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī tassā bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.4.eng: And Udāyī would sit down in private alone with that nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.5.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.5.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā udāyī bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.6.eng: “How can Venerable Udāyī sit down in private alone with a nun?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, udāyi, bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.7.eng: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.10.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.10.eng: “Foolish man, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.12.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.12.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.13.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:1.13.1.eng: ‘If a monk sits down in private alone with a nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.6.eng: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.10.eng: just the monk and the nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.12.eng: private to the eye and private to the ear.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.14.pli: na sakkā hoti akkhiṃ vā nikhaṇīyamāne bhamukaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne sīsaṃ vā ukkhipīyamāne passituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.14.eng: one is unable to see them winking, raising an eyebrow, or nodding.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.16.eng: one is unable to hear ordinary speech.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.18.pli: bhikkhuniyā nisinnāya bhikkhu upanisinno vā hoti upanipanno vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.18.eng: if the monk sits down or lies down next to the seated nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.19.pli: Bhikkhu nisinne bhikkhunī upanisinnā vā hoti upanipannā vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.19.eng: If the nun sits down or lies down next to the seated monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.20.pli: Ubho vā nisinnā honti ubho vā nipannā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.1.20.eng: If both are seated or both are lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.1.pli: Raho rahosaññī eko ekāya nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.1.eng: If it is private, and he perceives it as such, and he sits down alone with a nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.2.pli: Raho vematiko eko ekāya nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.2.eng: If it is private, but he is unsure of it, and he sits down alone with a nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.3.pli: Raho arahosaññī eko ekāya nisajjaṃ kappeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.3.eng: If it is private, but he does not perceive it as such, and he sits down alone with a nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.4.eng: If it is not private, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.5.eng: If it is not private, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.2.6.eng: If it is not private, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.2.eng: if he has a companion who understands;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.3.eng: if he stands and does not sit down;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.4.eng: if he is not seeking privacy;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.5.eng: if he sits down preoccupied with something else;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.5.comm: Sp 5.467: Aññavihitoti aññaṁ cintayamāno, “Aññavihita: thinking of something else.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.8.eng: The training rule on sitting in private, the tenth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.9.eng: The third subchapter on the instruction is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.12.eng: Dwelling place, worldly gain, and with giving;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc30:2.3.13.eng: He sews, a road, a boat, should eat,
